docs.lead_paragraph: Whistle-blower suits claim Health Management Associates tried to inflate its Medicare and Medicaid payments by admitting more patients.

headline.main: Hospital Chain Said to Scheme to Inflate Bills
headline.print_headline: Hospital Chain Said to Scheme to Inflate Bills

docs.abstract: Justice Department joins eight separate whistle-blower suits claiming for-profit hospital chain Health Management Associates tried to inflate Medicare and Medicaid payments by admitting more patients regardless of whether hospital care was needed, and pressuring doctors at hospitals in six states to increase admissions; similar accusations are being raised at other hospital and medical groups as health care undergoes sweeping changes.
docs.snippet: Whistle-blower suits claim Health Management Associates tried to inflate its Medicare and Medicaid payments by admitting more patients.

byline.original: By JULIE CRESWELL and REED ABELSON

docs.lead_paragraph: A psychologist discusses fraudulent claims of trauma to qualify for disability benefits.
docs.snippet: A psychologist discusses fraudulent claims of trauma to qualify for disability benefits.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the Fed grew more optimistic about the unemployment rate, it grew less optimistic about overall economic growth.

headline.main: Don’t Expect Job Data Alone to Persuade Fed on Rates
headline.print_headline: Don’t Expect Job Data to Persuade Fed on Rates

docs.abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column argues that Federal Reserve is unlikely to raise interest rates under new chairwoman Janet L Yellen, even if unemployment falls below previously-established target of 6.5 percent; notes that while Fed has grown more optimistic about unemployment, it has grown less so about overall economic growth.
docs.snippet: As the Fed grew more optimistic about the unemployment rate, it grew less optimistic about overall economic growth.

docs.lead_paragraph: Vincent Asaro, 78, was accused of playing a role in the robbery at Kennedy International Airport during which a group made away with about $5 million in cash and nearly $1 million in jewels.

headline.main: As Seen in ‘Goodfellas’: Arrest Is Made in ’78 Lufthansa Robbery
headline.print_headline: As Seen in ‘Goodfellas’: Arrest Is Made in ’78 Lufthansa Robbery

docs.abstract: Federal authorities arrest organized crime figure Vincent Asaro, accusing him of playing a role in 1978 robbery from Lufthansa cargo building at Kennedy International Airport during which a group made away with about $5 million in cash and nearly $1 million in jewels; unsolved case played role in movie Goodfellas, and little of money was ever recovered.
docs.snippet: Vincent Asaro, 78, was accused of playing a role in the robbery at Kennedy International Airport during which a group made away with about $5 million in cash and nearly $1 million in jewels.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kitty Bennett, Sheelagh McNeill, Nate Schweber and Mosi Secret.Reporting was contributed by Kitty Bennett, Sheelagh McNeill, Nate Schweber and Mosi Secret.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Thursday said people enrolled in some small, government-sponsored healthcare plans will not face a penalty under Obamacare in 2014, even though their coverage does not meet the healthcare reform law's minimum requirements.

headline.main: No Obamacare Penalty for Few in Some Niche Government Plans: IRS
headline.print_headline: No Obamacare Penalty for Few in Some Niche Government Plans: IRS

docs.snippet: The Obama administration on Thursday said people enrolled in some small, government-sponsored healthcare plans will not face a penalty under Obamacare in 2014, even though their coverage does not meet the healthcare reform law's minimum requirements.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge granted a preliminary injunction Thursday against Missouri's law requiring a state license to serve as a navigator to help consumers sign up for coverage through the new health insurance marketplace.

headline.main: Judge Stops Mo. Law on Health Navigator Licensing
headline.print_headline: Judge Stops Mo. Law on Health Navigator Licensing

docs.snippet: A federal judge granted a preliminary injunction Thursday against Missouri's law requiring a state license to serve as a navigator to help consumers sign up for coverage through the new health insurance marketplace.
